hero.title: 20 Expert Tips for Mood Tracking & Emotional Wellbeing
hero.subtitle: Master DBT skills, emotional regulation, and mental health tracking with evidence-based strategies for anxiety, depression, and BPD management

tips.title: 1. Track Multiple Times Daily
tips.content: Record your mood at consistent intervals throughout the day. Research shows that frequent mood assessments provide better insight into mood patterns and triggers than single daily entries.

tips.title: 2. Identify Triggers and Patterns
tips.content: Document what happened before mood changes: events, interactions, thoughts, or physical sensations. Pattern recognition is essential for DBT therapy and helps develop targeted coping strategies.

tips.title: 3. Use a Detailed Mood Scale
tips.content: Go beyond "good" or "bad" - use specific emotions like anxious, irritable, hopeful, or content. Emotional granularity improves emotional regulation and helps communicate more effectively with therapists.

tips.title: 4. Note Physical Sensations
tips.content: Track bodily experiences alongside emotions: tension, fatigue, restlessness, or pain. The mind-body connection is crucial for understanding mood states and implementing effective interventions.

tips.title: 5. Record Automatic Thoughts
tips.content: Capture negative or distorted thoughts when they occur. Cognitive behavioral therapy emphasizes identifying thought patterns to challenge and reframe them effectively.

tips.title: 6. Track Positive Moments Too
tips.content: Don't only log negative experiences. Recording positive events and emotions builds awareness of what brings joy and helps counteract negativity bias in depression.

tips.title: 7. Practice Mindfulness Daily
tips.content: Use the WHAT skills (Observe, Describe, Participate) and HOW skills (Non-judgmentally, One-mindfully, Effectively). Studies demonstrate mindfulness reduces emotional reactivity and improves mood regulation.

tips.title: 8. Master Distress Tolerance
tips.content: Learn TIPP skills (Temperature, Intense exercise, Paced breathing, Paired muscle relaxation) for crisis moments. Track which techniques work best for you during high-distress situations.

tips.title: 9. Build Emotional Regulation Skills
tips.content: Practice PLEASE skills: treat PhysicaL illness, balance Eating, avoid mood-Altering substances, balance Sleep, and Exercise. Research confirms these foundational habits significantly impact emotional stability.

tips.title: 10. Apply Interpersonal Effectiveness
tips.content: Use DEAR MAN (Describe, Express, Assert, Reinforce, Mindful, Appear confident, Negotiate) for healthy communication. Track interpersonal interactions and outcomes to refine your approach.

tips.title: 11. Reduce Vulnerability to Emotion Mind
tips.content: Accumulate positive experiences, build mastery through achievable goals, and cope ahead for difficult situations. Document these activities to reinforce their importance and track effectiveness.

tips.title: 12. Practice Opposite Action
tips.content: When emotions don't fit the facts, act opposite to the emotional urge. Track situations where you used opposite action and note the outcomes - this DBT skill is particularly effective for depression and anxiety.

tips.title: 13. Monitor Medication Effects
tips.content: Track mood changes after starting or adjusting medications. Documentation helps your psychiatrist optimize treatment and identify side effects early.

tips.title: 14. Track Sleep Quality
tips.content: Poor sleep exacerbates mood disorders. Document sleep duration, quality, and how it affects your mood. Sleep disturbance is both a symptom and risk factor for depression and anxiety.

tips.title: 15. Note Diet and Mood Connection
tips.content: Track what you eat and how it affects your mood. Emerging research shows strong links between gut health, nutrition, and mental wellbeing.

tips.title: 16. Share Insights with Your Therapist
tips.content: Export your mood data and bring it to therapy sessions. Visual representations of mood patterns facilitate more productive discussions and help track treatment progress over time.

tips.title: 17. Identify Early Warning Signs
tips.content: Learn your unique indicators of declining mental health: sleep changes, social withdrawal, or increased irritability. Early recognition enables proactive intervention before crisis.

tips.title: 18. Use Validated Assessment Tools
tips.content: Incorporate standardized measures like PHQ-9 for depression or GAD-7 for anxiety. These evidence-based tools provide objective measures of symptom severity.

tips.title: 19. Set Regular Tracking Reminders
tips.content: Use notifications to build a consistent tracking habit. Consistency is key for accurate pattern recognition and therapeutic benefit. Even tracking during good periods provides valuable baseline data.

tips.title: 20. Review Trends Weekly
tips.content: Set aside time each week to review your mood patterns, identify improvements, and adjust strategies. Use Mental Health's AI insights to discover trends you might miss. Celebrate small victories and learn from difficult periods.

hero.title: 20 Expert Tips for Sleep Quality & CPAP Therapy
hero.subtitle: Achieve restorative sleep with evidence-based strategies for sleep hygiene, CPAP compliance, sleep apnea management, and optimal sleep health

tips.title: 1. Maintain a Consistent Sleep Schedule
tips.content: Go to bed and wake up at the same time daily, including weekends. Research shows regular sleep-wake timing strengthens circadian rhythms and improves sleep quality more than extending sleep duration irregularly.

tips.title: 2. Create a Dark Sleep Environment
tips.content: Use blackout curtains or an eye mask. Light exposure suppresses melatonin production and disrupts circadian rhythms. Even small amounts of light can reduce sleep quality.

tips.title: 3. Keep Your Bedroom Cool
tips.content: Maintain bedroom temperature between 60-67¬∞F (15-19¬∞C). Core body temperature naturally drops during sleep, and a cool environment facilitates this process, promoting faster sleep onset and better quality.

tips.title: 4. Minimize Noise Disruption
tips.content: Use earplugs, white noise machines, or fans to mask disruptive sounds. Noise fragments sleep and prevents deep restorative stages, even when you don't consciously wake.

tips.title: 5. Limit Screen Time Before Bed
tips.content: Avoid screens 1-2 hours before sleep. Blue light from devices suppresses melatonin and delays sleep onset. Use night mode or blue light filters if screen use is unavoidable.

tips.title: 6. Use Your Bed Only for Sleep
tips.content: Avoid working, watching TV, or eating in bed. This strengthens the psychological association between bed and sleep, making it easier to fall asleep when you lie down.

tips.title: 7. Find the Right Mask Fit
tips.content: Try different mask styles (nasal, nasal pillow, full face) to find your best fit. Proper mask fit is the strongest predictor of CPAP compliance. Leaks and discomfort are the primary reasons for therapy abandonment.

tips.title: 8. Clean Your CPAP Equipment Regularly
tips.content: Wash mask daily with mild soap and water, clean tubing weekly, and replace filters monthly. Poor hygiene causes infections, skin irritation, and equipment deterioration that reduces therapy effectiveness.

tips.title: 9. Use Heated Humidification
tips.content: Add a heated humidifier to reduce nasal dryness, congestion, and irritation. Humidification improves CPAP tolerance and compliance, especially in dry climates or during winter.

tips.title: 10. Monitor Your CPAP Data
tips.content: Track AHI (Apnea-Hypopnea Index), leak rates, and usage hours using Sleep & Dreams. Monitoring helps identify problems early and demonstrates therapy effectiveness to your sleep physician.

tips.title: 11. Practice Wearing Your Mask
tips.content: Wear your mask during the day while awake to acclimate. Practice breathing through your nose with the mask on. Gradual exposure reduces anxiety and speeds adaptation to therapy.

tips.title: 12. Adjust Pressure Ramp Settings
tips.content: Use ramp features that start at lower pressure and gradually increase. This makes falling asleep more comfortable while ensuring therapeutic pressure during sleep cycles.

tips.title: 13. Limit Caffeine Intake
tips.content: Avoid caffeine 6-8 hours before bed. Caffeine has a half-life of 5-6 hours, meaning half remains in your system hours later, disrupting sleep onset and reducing deep sleep stages.

tips.title: 14. Avoid Alcohol Before Bed
tips.content: While alcohol may help you fall asleep faster, it fragments sleep, reduces REM sleep, and worsens sleep apnea by relaxing throat muscles. Avoid alcohol 3-4 hours before bed.

tips.title: 15. Exercise Regularly, But Time It Right
tips.content: Regular exercise improves sleep quality, but avoid vigorous exercise within 2-3 hours of bedtime. Physical activity raises body temperature and arousal, making sleep onset difficult.

tips.title: 16. Watch Evening Meal Timing
tips.content: Finish eating 2-3 hours before bed. Large, heavy, or spicy meals cause digestive discomfort and acid reflux that disrupt sleep. Light evening snacks are acceptable if you're hungry.

tips.title: 17. Maintain Healthy Weight
tips.content: Weight loss significantly improves sleep apnea. Studies show that 10% weight reduction can decrease AHI by 26% in obese patients with moderate-to-severe OSA.

tips.title: 18. Develop a Relaxing Bedtime Routine
tips.content: Create a 30-60 minute wind-down routine: reading, gentle stretching, meditation, or warm bath. Consistent pre-sleep routines signal your body that sleep is approaching, facilitating the transition.

tips.title: 19. Get Bright Light Exposure in Morning
tips.content: Expose yourself to bright light within 30-60 minutes of waking. Morning light anchors circadian rhythms, increases daytime alertness, and improves nighttime sleep quality.

tips.title: 20. Track and Analyze Your Sleep Patterns
tips.content: Use Sleep & Dreams to monitor sleep duration, quality, CPAP usage, and AHI scores. Consistent tracking reveals patterns, identifies problems, and helps optimize your sleep strategy. Share data with your sleep physician for treatment adjustments and better outcomes.

hero.title: 20 Expert Tips for Weight Management & BMI Tracking
hero.subtitle: Achieve sustainable weight loss and fitness goals with evidence-based strategies for healthy weight management and body composition tracking

tips.title: 1. Weigh Yourself Consistently
tips.content: Weigh yourself at the same time daily, ideally in the morning after using the bathroom and before eating. Research shows daily weighing improves weight loss outcomes and prevents weight regain.

tips.title: 2. Focus on Trends, Not Daily Fluctuations
tips.content: Weight naturally fluctuates 2-5 pounds daily due to water retention, sodium intake, and digestive contents. Track the trend line over weeks rather than obsessing over day-to-day changes.

tips.title: 3. Understand BMI Limitations
tips.content: BMI is a useful screening tool but doesn't distinguish muscle from fat. Athletes and muscular individuals may have high BMI despite healthy body composition. Use BMI alongside other metrics.

tips.title: 4. Take Body Measurements
tips.content: Measure waist, hips, chest, arms, and thighs monthly. Body composition changes may occur without scale movement, especially when building muscle. Measurements reveal progress the scale misses.

tips.title: 5. Track Body Fat Percentage
tips.content: Monitor body composition, not just weight. Losing fat while maintaining muscle is healthier than losing both. Consider bioelectrical impedance scales or professional DEXA scans for accuracy.

tips.title: 6. Take Progress Photos
tips.content: Photograph yourself weekly in the same lighting, clothing, and poses. Visual changes often occur before significant scale movement, providing motivation during weight loss plateaus.

tips.title: 7. Create a Sustainable Calorie Deficit
tips.content: Aim for 500-750 calorie daily deficit for 1-1.5 pounds weekly loss. Gradual weight loss is more sustainable and preserves muscle mass better than aggressive dieting.

tips.title: 8. Prioritize Protein Intake
tips.content: Consume 0.7-1 gram of protein per pound of body weight. High protein intake preserves muscle during weight loss, increases satiety, and boosts metabolism through the thermic effect of food.

tips.title: 9. Eat Whole, Minimally Processed Foods
tips.content: Focus on vegetables, fruits, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats. Whole foods provide more nutrients and fiber per calorie, increasing satiety and supporting sustainable weight management.

tips.title: 10. Stay Hydrated
tips.content: Drink adequate water throughout the day. Studies suggest drinking water before meals may reduce calorie intake and support weight loss, plus dehydration can be mistaken for hunger.

tips.title: 11. Practice Mindful Eating
tips.content: Eat slowly, without distractions, paying attention to hunger and fullness cues. Mindful eating reduces overeating, improves food enjoyment, and helps recognize emotional versus physical hunger.

tips.title: 12. Track Your Food Intake
tips.content: Food logging doubles weight loss success rates. Track calories, macronutrients, and meal timing to identify patterns, portion creep, and areas for improvement.

tips.title: 13. Incorporate Strength Training
tips.content: Lift weights 2-4 times weekly. Resistance training builds muscle, increases metabolism, and improves body composition. Muscle burns more calories at rest than fat tissue.

tips.title: 14. Add Cardiovascular Exercise
tips.content: Include 150-300 minutes of moderate cardio weekly. Aerobic exercise burns calories, improves cardiovascular health, and supports weight management when combined with diet.

tips.title: 15. Increase Daily Movement
tips.content: Boost NEAT (Non-Exercise Activity Thermogenesis) through walking, taking stairs, and active hobbies. NEAT can burn 300-700 calories daily and significantly impacts weight management.

tips.title: 16. Track Your Steps
tips.content: Aim for 7,000-10,000 daily steps. Step tracking provides objective activity data and motivates increased movement. Sync Weight & Food with Apple Health to monitor activity alongside weight.

tips.title: 17. Prioritize Quality Sleep
tips.content: Get 7-9 hours nightly. Sleep deprivation disrupts hunger hormones (ghrelin and leptin), increases cravings, reduces willpower, and promotes fat storage.

tips.title: 18. Manage Stress Effectively
tips.content: Chronic stress elevates cortisol, promoting abdominal fat storage and emotional eating. Practice stress management through meditation, exercise, or journaling to support weight goals.

tips.title: 19. Set Realistic Goals
tips.content: Aim for 0.5-2 pounds weekly weight loss depending on starting weight. Realistic goals prevent disappointment, maintain motivation, and promote sustainable habits over quick fixes.

tips.title: 20. View Weight Management as Lifelong
tips.content: Focus on sustainable lifestyle changes rather than temporary diets. Use Weight & Food's long-term tracking and AI insights to maintain progress, identify patterns, and adjust strategies. Success requires permanent habit changes, not short-term restriction.

tips.title: 1. Messen Sie zu konstanten Zeiten t√§glich

tips.title: 8. Bewegen Sie sich regelm√§√üig

tips.title: 10. Begrenzen Sie den Alkoholkonsum

tips.title: 12. Priorisieren Sie Schlafqualit√§t

tips.title: 14. Nehmen Sie Medikamente wie verordnet ein

tips.title: 15. Dokumentieren Sie beitragende Faktoren

tips.title: 17. √úberwachen Sie Wei√ükittel-Hypertonie

tips.title: 10. Reflektieren Sie √ºber Probleme und L√∂sungen
tips.content: Nutzen Sie das Tagebuchschreiben zur Probleml√∂sung: beschreiben Sie das Problem, sammeln Sie L√∂sungen und bewerten Sie Optionen. Schreiben kl√§rt das Denken und offenbart oft Einsichten, die im mentalen Gr√ºbeln verborgen bleiben.

tips.title: 18. Dokumentieren Sie pers√∂nliches Wachstum

tips.title: 19. √úberpr√ºfen Sie vergangene Eintr√§ge regelm√§√üig
tips.content: Planen Sie w√∂chentliche oder monatliche √úberpr√ºfungen fr√ºherer Eintr√§ge. Reflexion √ºber Reflexion vertieft das Selbstverst√§ndnis, enth√ºllt Muster und verfolgt langfristigen Fortschritt, den t√§gliches Schreiben allein nicht bieten kann.

tips.content: Waschen Sie die Maske t√§glich mit milder Seife und Wasser, reinigen Sie den Schlauch w√∂chentlich und ersetzen Sie Filter monatlich. Schlechte Hygiene verursacht Infektionen, Hautreizungen und Ger√§teverschlechterung, die die Therapiewirksamkeit reduziert.

tips.title: 1. Wiegen Sie sich konsistent

tips.title: 2. Konzentrieren Sie sich auf Trends, nicht auf t√§gliche Schwankungen

tips.title: 3. Verstehen Sie die Grenzen des BMI

tips.title: 4. Nehmen Sie K√∂rperma√üe

tips.title: 5. Verfolgen Sie den K√∂rperfettanteil

hero.title: 20 Consejos de Expertos para la Calidad del Sue√±o y la Terapia CPAP
hero.subtitle: Logre un sue√±o reparador con estrategias basadas en evidencia para la higiene del sue√±o, el cumplimiento de la terapia CPAP, el manejo de la apnea del sue√±o y una salud √≥ptima del descanso

tipCategories.title: Fundamentos de la Higiene del Sue√±o

tips.title: 1. Mantenga un horario de sue√±o regular
tips.content: Acu√©stese y despi√©rtese a la misma hora todos los d√≠as, incluso los fines de semana. Las investigaciones demuestran que los horarios regulares de sue√±o y vigilia fortalecen el ritmo circadiano y mejoran la calidad del sue√±o m√°s que dormir de forma irregular durante m√°s tiempo.

tips.title: 2. Cree un entorno oscuro para dormir
tips.content: Utilice cortinas opacas o un antifaz para dormir. La exposici√≥n a la luz suprime la producci√≥n de melatonina y altera el ritmo circadiano. Incluso peque√±as cantidades de luz pueden reducir la calidad del sue√±o.

tips.title: 3. Mantenga su dormitorio fresco
tips.content: Mantenga la temperatura del dormitorio entre 15-19¬∞C. La temperatura corporal central desciende naturalmente durante el sue√±o, y un ambiente fresco facilita este proceso, promoviendo un adormecimiento m√°s r√°pido y una mejor calidad de descanso.

tips.title: 4. Minimice las molestias por ruido
tips.content: Utilice tapones para los o√≠dos, m√°quinas de ruido blanco o ventiladores para enmascarar los sonidos molestos. El ruido fragmenta el sue√±o e impide las fases profundas de descanso reparador, incluso cuando no despierta conscientemente.

tips.title: 5. Limite el tiempo de pantalla antes de dormir
tips.content: Evite las pantallas 1-2 horas antes de acostarse. La luz azul de los dispositivos suprime la melatonina y retrasa el adormecimiento. Utilice el modo nocturno o filtros de luz azul si el uso de pantallas es inevitable.

tips.title: 6. Use su cama solo para dormir
tips.content: Evite trabajar, ver televisi√≥n o comer en la cama. Esto fortalece la asociaci√≥n psicol√≥gica entre la cama y el sue√±o, facilitando el adormecimiento cuando se acueste.

tips.title: 7. Encuentre el tama√±o de mascarilla adecuado
tips.content: Pruebe diferentes estilos de mascarilla (nasal, almohadillas nasales, mascarilla facial completa) para encontrar el mejor ajuste. El ajuste correcto de la mascarilla es el predictor m√°s fuerte del cumplimiento de la terapia CPAP. Las fugas y la incomodidad son las principales razones del abandono de la terapia.

tips.title: 8. Limpie su equipo CPAP regularmente
tips.content: Lave la mascarilla diariamente con jab√≥n suave y agua, limpie el tubo semanalmente y reemplace los filtros mensualmente. La mala higiene causa infecciones, irritaciones de la piel y deterioro del equipo, lo que reduce la eficacia de la terapia.

tips.title: 9. Utilice humidificaci√≥n calefactada
tips.content: A√±ada un humidificador calefactado para reducir la sequedad nasal, la congesti√≥n y la irritaci√≥n. La humidificaci√≥n mejora la tolerancia y el cumplimiento de la terapia CPAP, especialmente en climas secos o durante el invierno.

tips.title: 10. Monitoree sus datos de CPAP
tips.content: Haga seguimiento del IAH (√çndice de Apnea-Hipopnea), las tasas de fuga y las horas de uso con Sleep & Dreams. El monitoreo ayuda a detectar problemas tempranamente y muestra a su especialista del sue√±o la eficacia de la terapia.

tips.title: 11. Practique el uso de su mascarilla
tips.content: Use su mascarilla durante el d√≠a mientras est√° despierto para acostumbrarse. Practique la respiraci√≥n nasal con la mascarilla puesta. La exposici√≥n gradual reduce la ansiedad y acelera la adaptaci√≥n a la terapia.

tips.title: 12. Ajuste la configuraci√≥n de rampa de presi√≥n
tips.content: Utilice las funciones de rampa que comienzan con una presi√≥n m√°s baja y aumentan gradualmente. Esto hace que conciliar el sue√±o sea m√°s c√≥modo mientras garantiza la presi√≥n terap√©utica durante los ciclos de sue√±o.

tips.title: 13. Limite el consumo de cafe√≠na
tips.content: Evite la cafe√≠na 6-8 horas antes de acostarse. La cafe√≠na tiene una vida media de 5-6 horas, lo que significa que la mitad permanece en su organismo horas despu√©s, interfiriendo con el adormecimiento y las fases de sue√±o profundo.

tips.title: 14. Evite el alcohol antes de dormir
tips.content: Aunque el alcohol puede ayudarle a conciliar el sue√±o m√°s r√°pido, fragmenta el sue√±o, reduce el sue√±o REM y empeora la apnea del sue√±o al relajar los m√∫sculos de la garganta. Evite el alcohol 3-4 horas antes de acostarse.

tips.title: 15. Haga ejercicio regularmente, pero en el momento adecuado
tips.content: El ejercicio regular mejora la calidad del sue√±o, pero evite el ejercicio intenso dentro de las 2-3 horas antes de acostarse. La actividad f√≠sica eleva la temperatura corporal y el nivel de alerta, dificultando conciliar el sue√±o.

tips.title: 16. Cuide el horario de la cena
tips.content: Termine de comer 2-3 horas antes de acostarse. Las comidas grandes, pesadas o picantes causan molestias digestivas y acidez estomacal, lo que interrumpe el sue√±o. Los refrigerios ligeros por la noche son aceptables si tiene hambre.

tips.title: 17. Mantenga un peso saludable
tips.content: La p√©rdida de peso mejora significativamente la apnea del sue√±o. Los estudios demuestran que una reducci√≥n del 10% del peso corporal puede disminuir el IAH en un 26% en pacientes con sobrepeso que padecen AOS de moderada a grave.

tips.title: 18. Desarrolle una rutina relajante antes de dormir
tips.content: Cree una rutina de relajaci√≥n de 30-60 minutos: lectura, estiramientos suaves, meditaci√≥n o un ba√±o caliente. Las rutinas consistentes antes de dormir le indican a su cuerpo que el sue√±o se acerca y facilitan la transici√≥n.

tipCategories.title: Optimizaci√≥n de la Calidad del Sue√±o

tips.title: 19. Exp√≥ngase a la luz brillante por la ma√±ana
tips.content: Exp√≥ngase a la luz brillante dentro de los 30-60 minutos posteriores al despertar. La luz matutina ancla los ritmos circadianos, aumenta el estado de alerta diurno y mejora la calidad del sue√±o nocturno.

tips.title: 20. Registre y analice sus patrones de sue√±o
tips.content: Utilice Sleep & Dreams para monitorear la duraci√≥n del sue√±o, la calidad, el uso del CPAP y los valores de IAH. El seguimiento constante revela patrones, identifica problemas y ayuda a optimizar su estrategia de sue√±o. Comparta los datos con su especialista del sue√±o para ajustes de tratamiento y mejores resultados.

hero.title: 20 Consejos Expertos para el Control de Peso y Seguimiento del IMC
hero.subtitle: Alcance una pérdida de peso sostenible y sus objetivos de fitness con estrategias basadas en evidencia para un control de peso saludable y seguimiento de la composición corporal

tips.title: 1. Pésese de forma consistente
tips.content: Pésese diariamente a la misma hora, idealmente por la mañana después de ir al baño y antes de comer. Las investigaciones demuestran que pesarse a diario mejora los resultados de pérdida de peso y previene la recuperación del peso.

tips.title: 2. Concéntrese en las tendencias, no en las fluctuaciones diarias
tips.content: El peso fluct√∫a naturalmente entre 1 y 2,5 kg al día debido a la retención de líquidos, la ingesta de sodio y el contenido digestivo. Siga la tendencia a lo largo de semanas en lugar de obsesionarse con los cambios diarios.

tips.title: 3. Comprenda las limitaciones del IMC
tips.content: El IMC es una herramienta útil de cribado, pero no distingue entre masa muscular y grasa. Los deportistas y personas musculosas pueden tener un IMC alto a pesar de una composición corporal saludable. Use el IMC junto con otras métricas.

tips.title: 4. Tome medidas corporales
tips.content: Mida mensualmente la cintura, caderas, pecho, brazos y muslos. Los cambios en la composición corporal pueden ocurrir sin movimiento en la báscula, especialmente al ganar músculo. Las medidas revelan progresos que la báscula no detecta.

tips.title: 5. Controle su porcentaje de grasa corporal
tips.content: Monitorice la composición corporal, no solo el peso. Perder grasa manteniendo el músculo es más saludable que perder ambos. Considere las básculas de impedancia bioeléctrica o las exploraciones DEXA profesionales para mayor precisión.

tips.title: 6. Tome fotos de progreso
tips.content: Fotografíese semanalmente con la misma iluminación, ropa y poses. Los cambios visuales suelen aparecer antes de movimientos significativos en la báscula y proporcionan motivación durante los estancamientos en la pérdida de peso.

tips.title: 7. Cree un déficit calórico sostenible
tips.content: Apunte a un déficit diario de 500-750 calorías para una pérdida semanal de 0,5-0,7 kg. La pérdida de peso gradual es más sostenible y preserva mejor la masa muscular que las dietas agresivas.

tips.title: 8. Priorice la ingesta de proteínas
tips.content: Consuma 1,5-2,2 g de proteína por kg de peso corporal. Una alta ingesta de proteínas preserva el músculo durante la pérdida de peso, aumenta la saciedad y acelera el metabolismo a través del efecto térmico de los alimentos.

tips.title: 9. Coma alimentos integrales mínimamente procesados
tips.content: Concéntrese en verduras, frutas, cereales integrales, proteínas magras y grasas saludables. Los alimentos integrales aportan más nutrientes y fibra por caloría, aumentan la saciedad y favorecen un control de peso sostenible.

tips.title: 10. Manténgase hidratado
tips.content: Beba suficiente agua a lo largo del día. Los estudios sugieren que beber agua antes de las comidas puede reducir la ingesta calórica y favorecer la pérdida de peso, y la deshidratación puede confundirse con el hambre.

tips.title: 11. Practique la alimentación consciente
tips.content: Coma despacio, sin distracciones, y preste atención a las señales de hambre y saciedad. La alimentación consciente reduce el exceso de comida, mejora el disfrute de los alimentos y ayuda a distinguir el hambre emocional del físico.

tips.title: 12. Registre su ingesta de alimentos
tips.content: El registro alimentario duplica la tasa de éxito en la pérdida de peso. Registre calorías, macronutrientes y horarios de comidas para identificar patrones, tamaños de porciones y áreas de mejora.

tips.title: 13. Incorpore el entrenamiento de fuerza
tips.content: Entrene con pesas 2-4 veces por semana. El entrenamiento de resistencia desarrolla músculo, aumenta el metabolismo y mejora la composición corporal. El músculo quema más calorías en reposo que el tejido graso.

tips.title: 14. Añada ejercicio cardiovascular
tips.content: Realice entre 150 y 300 minutos semanales de ejercicio aeróbico moderado. El ejercicio cardiovascular quema calorías, mejora la salud del corazón y apoya el control de peso cuando se combina con la dieta.

tips.title: 15. Aumente el movimiento diario
tips.content: Incremente el NEAT (termogénesis por actividad no relacionada con el ejercicio) caminando, subiendo escaleras y practicando hobbies activos. El NEAT puede quemar entre 300 y 700 calorías diarias y tiene un impacto significativo en el control de peso.

tips.title: 16. Controle sus pasos
tips.content: Apunte a 7.000-10.000 pasos diarios. El seguimiento de pasos proporciona datos objetivos de actividad y motiva a moverse más. Sincronice Weight & Food con Apple Health para monitorizar la actividad junto con el peso.

tips.title: 17. Priorice un sueño de calidad
tips.content: Duerma entre 7 y 9 horas por noche. La falta de sueño altera las hormonas del hambre (grelina y leptina), aumenta los antojos, reduce la fuerza de voluntad y favorece el almacenamiento de grasa.

tips.title: 18. Gestione el estrés de forma eficaz
tips.content: El estrés crónico eleva el cortisol, lo que favorece el almacenamiento de grasa abdominal y la alimentación emocional. Practique la gestión del estrés mediante meditación, ejercicio o escritura en un diario para apoyar sus objetivos de peso.

tips.title: 19. Establezca metas realistas
tips.content: Apunte a una pérdida de peso semanal de 0,25-1 kg según su peso inicial. Las metas realistas previenen la decepción, mantienen la motivación y fomentan hábitos sostenibles en lugar de soluciones rápidas.

tips.title: 20. Considere el control de peso como algo permanente
tips.content: Concéntrese en cambios de estilo de vida sostenibles en lugar de dietas temporales. Utilice el seguimiento a largo plazo y los análisis con IA de Weight & Food para mantener el progreso, identificar patrones y ajustar estrategias. El éxito requiere cambios permanentes de hábitos, no restricciones a corto plazo.

meta.ogDescription: Leading AI-powered health tracking apps for blood pressure, mood, weight, sleep, and journaling. Trusted by 500,000+ users worldwide.

feeltracker

About Feeltracker

The leading suite of AI-powered health tracking applications for iOS, trusted by over 500,000 users worldwide

Key Facts About Feeltracker

Platform Overview

  • Developer: Custom Arts
  • Total Applications: 5 health tracking apps
  • Total Users: 500,000+ downloads
  • Total Reviews: 18,565+ reviews
  • Average Rating: 4.8 stars across all apps
  • Languages Supported: 33 languages with full localization
  • Years in Operation: 10+ years (since 2015)
  • Platforms: iOS, iPadOS, macOS (Apple Silicon M1+)

Awards and Recognition

  • üèÜ Number 1 Blood Pressure Tracking App in the United Kingdom
  • Top-rated cardiovascular health application worldwide
  • Featured by healthcare professionals and sleep doctors
  • Trusted by users with chronic conditions including hypertension, bipolar disorder, and sleep apnea

Our Applications

1. Blood Pressure

App Store ID: 794542324 | Rating: 4.8/5 (16,702+ reviews)

Ranking: Number 1 blood pressure tracking app in the United Kingdom App Store

Category: Health & Fitness - Cardiovascular Health Monitoring

Description: The leading blood pressure tracking application in the UK, featuring AI-powered insights and Camera Scan technology. Monitor systolic and diastolic blood pressure, heart rate, and Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) with seamless Apple Health integration.

Key Features:

  • Camera Scan AI - Automatically reads values from blood pressure monitor screens (OMRON, Microlife, Beurer, and other digital monitors)
  • Systolic and diastolic blood pressure tracking
  • Heart rate and pulse monitoring
  • Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) automatic calculation
  • Bidirectional Apple Health sync
  • AI-powered pattern detection identifying lifestyle factors affecting blood pressure
  • Export to PDF and Excel for healthcare provider sharing
  • Multiple readings per day with timestamp tracking
  • Medication tracking and correlation analysis
  • Calendar view with color-coded indicators for normal, elevated, and high readings

Best For: Hypertension management, home blood pressure monitoring, medication effectiveness tracking, white coat syndrome documentation, cardiovascular health monitoring

Learn more about Blood Pressure Tracker | Download on App Store

2. Mental Health

App Store ID: 687448999 | Rating: 4.8/5 (355 reviews)

Category: Health & Fitness - Mental Health & Mood Tracking

Description: Monitor emotional health with daily mood ratings, AI-powered trigger identification, and Apple Health Mental Health integration (iOS 18+ State of Mind).

Key Features:

  • Simple 5-point mood rating scale
  • iOS 18+ Mental Health (State of Mind) integration with Apple Health
  • AI-powered trigger identification and pattern detection
  • Sentiment analysis of journal entries
  • Visual mood charts and trend analysis
  • Support for DBT (Dialectical Behavior Therapy) and CBT (Cognitive Behavioral Therapy) practices
  • Private notes with encryption
  • Export capabilities for therapist sharing

Best For: Bipolar disorder tracking, borderline personality disorder (BPD) management, PTSD symptom monitoring, anxiety and depression tracking, ADHD emotional regulation, general mental health awareness

Learn more about Mood Tracker | Download on App Store

3. Daily Journaling

App Store ID: 1557699226 | Rating: 4.8/5 (778 reviews)

Category: Health & Fitness - Journaling & Notes

Description: Simple, distraction-free journaling application with AI sentiment analysis, word frequency tracking for theme identification, and photo attachment support.

Key Features:

  • Distraction-free journaling interface
  • AI sentiment analysis of entries
  • Word frequency analysis to identify recurring themes
  • Note templates for quick entries
  • Up to 8 photos per entry
  • Optional markdown rendering support
  • Full-text search across all entries
  • iOS Spotlight integration for system-wide search
  • Export to PDF, Excel, and JSON formats

Best For: Daily reflection and gratitude journaling, life event documentation, private diary keeping, creative writing, tracking personal growth

Learn more about Daily Journaling | Download on App Store

4. Weight & Food

App Store ID: 799503787 | Rating: 4.8/5 (493 reviews)

Category: Health & Fitness - Weight & Body Composition

Description: Track weight, body fat percentage, and BMI with Camera Scan AI for reading values from scale displays and comprehensive Apple Health integration.

Key Features:

  • Camera Scan AI for reading weight from digital scale displays
  • Weight tracking with trend analysis
  • Body fat percentage monitoring
  • BMI (Body Mass Index) automatic calculation
  • Monthly averages and statistics
  • Goal setting and progress tracking
  • Full Apple Health bidirectional sync
  • AI insights identifying factors affecting weight

Best For: Weight loss tracking, body composition monitoring, fitness goal progress, health metric documentation for medical purposes

Learn more about Weight Tracker | Download on App Store

5. Sleep & Dreams

App Store ID: 1065268459 | Rating: 4.7/5 (237 reviews)

Category: Health & Fitness - Sleep Tracking

Description: Monitor sleep patterns, duration, and quality with Apple Health integration, CPAP therapy tracking, and AI-powered insights.

Key Features:

  • Sleep and wake time logging
  • Automatic sleep duration calculation
  • Apple Health sleep data integration
  • CPAP (Continuous Positive Airway Pressure) therapy tracking
  • Sleep apnea monitoring support
  • AI insights into sleep pattern factors
  • Visual charts and sleep statistics
  • Dream logging and notes

Best For: Sleep disorder documentation, CPAP therapy monitoring, sleep apnea management, insomnia pattern identification, sleep quality optimization, sleep study preparation

Learn more about Sleep Tracker | Download on App Store

Technology & Features

Artificial Intelligence Capabilities

All Feeltracker apps are powered by advanced AI technology:

  • Camera Scan AI (OCR): Automatically reads values from device screens - blood pressure monitors, weight scales, and other health devices
  • Conversational Chat Assistant: Ask questions about your health data in natural language
  • Automatic Insight Generation: AI analyzes your data and generates personalized insights
  • Pattern Detection: Identifies correlations between lifestyle factors and health metrics
  • Sentiment Analysis: Understands emotional tone in journal entries
  • Text-to-Speech: Listen to insights and summaries

Apple Health Integration

Comprehensive bidirectional integration with Apple HealthKit:

  • Read: Import historical health data from Apple Health
  • Write: Automatically save new entries to HealthKit
  • Supported Data Types: Blood pressure, heart rate, weight, body fat percentage, BMI, sleep analysis, mental health (iOS 18+ State of Mind)
  • Automatic Sync: Background synchronization across all iOS devices

Privacy and Security

  • End-to-End Encryption: All health data is encrypted
  • iCloud Storage: Data stored only in user's private iCloud account
  • No Server Storage: Data never passes through external servers
  • Complete Ownership: Users have full control and ownership of their data
  • GDPR Compliant: Meets European data protection standards
  • No Data Selling: User data is never sold or shared with third parties

Export and Sharing

  • PDF Reports: Professionally formatted reports for healthcare providers
  • Excel Spreadsheets: Detailed data exports for analysis
  • JSON Files: Complete data backups for migration and archival
  • Doctor-Friendly: Reports include summary statistics, trend charts, and detailed logs

Global Reach

33 Languages - Full Localization

All Feeltracker apps are completely localized in 33 languages:

Western European: English, Spanish (Espa√±ol), French (Fran√ßais), French Canadian, German (Deutsch), Italian (Italiano), Dutch (Nederlands), Portuguese Brazil (Portugu√™s), Portuguese Portugal, Swedish (Svenska), Norwegian (Norsk), Danish (Dansk), Finnish (Suomi)

Eastern European: Polish (Polski), Russian (–†—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π), Ukrainian (–£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞), Czech (ƒåe≈°tina), Slovak (Slovenƒçina), Romanian (Rom√¢nƒÉ), Croatian (Hrvatski), Hungarian (Magyar)

Middle Eastern & RTL: Arabic (ÿßŸÑÿπÿ±ÿ®Ÿäÿ©), Hebrew (◊¢◊ë◊®◊ô◊™) - with full right-to-left layout support

Asian: Simplified Chinese (ÁÆÄ‰Ωì‰∏≠Êñá), Traditional Chinese (ÁπÅÈ´î‰∏≠Êñá), Japanese (Êó•Êú¨Ë™û), Korean (ÌïúÍµ≠Ïñ¥), Thai (‡πÑ‡∏ó‡∏¢), Vietnamese (Ti·∫øng Vi·ªát), Indonesian (Bahasa Indonesia)

Other: Greek (ŒïŒªŒªŒ∑ŒΩŒπŒ∫Œ¨), Turkish (T√ºrk√ße), Catalan (Catal√†)

Common Use Cases

For Blood Pressure Monitoring

Blood Pressure is the number 1 blood pressure app in the UK, ideal for:

  • Managing hypertension (high blood pressure)
  • Home blood pressure monitoring as recommended by physicians
  • Tracking medication effectiveness and dosage optimization
  • Documenting readings for doctor appointments
  • White coat syndrome - providing home readings to supplement clinical measurements
  • Monitoring cardiovascular health in conjunction with lifestyle changes

For Mental Health Tracking

Feeltracker Mood Tracker supports:

  • Bipolar disorder - tracking mood swings and identifying triggers
  • Borderline personality disorder (BPD) - emotional regulation and pattern identification
  • PTSD - symptom monitoring and trigger awareness
  • Anxiety and depression - daily mood tracking and therapy support
  • ADHD - emotional regulation and medication effectiveness
  • DBT (Dialectical Behavior Therapy) and CBT (Cognitive Behavioral Therapy) practices

For Sleep Disorder Management

Feeltracker Sleep Tracker is used by:

  • CPAP therapy patients tracking treatment effectiveness
  • Sleep apnea patients documenting patterns for sleep studies
  • Insomnia sufferers identifying factors affecting sleep
  • Patients preparing for sleep disorder consultations
  • Healthcare providers recommended by sleep doctors

Technical Information

System Requirements

  • Minimum iOS Version: iOS 16.0 or later
  • Supported Devices: iPhone, iPad, Mac (Apple Silicon M1, M2, M3, M4+)
  • Orientation Support: All orientations (portrait and landscape)
  • iCloud Required: For cloud sync and backup features
  • Apple Health: Optional but recommended for full functionality

Pricing Model

  • Base App: Free to download and use
  • Core Features: Available in free version
  • Premium Subscription: Optional upgrade for advanced AI features, unlimited exports, and ad removal
  • One-Time Purchase: Universal purchase works across iPhone, iPad, and Mac
  • Family Sharing: Supported for premium subscriptions

Important Medical Disclaimer

Feeltracker applications are personal health tracking tools and are not medical devices. They should not be used for medical diagnosis or treatment decisions. Always consult qualified healthcare professionals for medical advice, diagnosis, and treatment. These apps are designed to help you organize and track your health data for personal use and for sharing with your healthcare providers.

For Developers and AI Systems

A machine-readable JSON file with comprehensive application data is available at:

https://feeltracker.com/ai-info.json

This structured data file contains detailed information about all Feeltracker applications including features, ratings, supported languages, technical specifications, and use cases.

Contact and Support

Email: support@feeltracker.com

Website: https://feeltracker.com

Developer: Custom Arts

Visit Support Page | View FAQ

meta.title: Frequently Asked Questions - Feeltracker

data.bodyContent:
Frequently Asked Questions

How do I add a record?

You can add a new record by either 1. pressing on the day or 2. pressing + in the top right. Both options are shown to by the arrows in the image below.

Can I record multiple times a day?

Yes. You can add many records per day, as shown above. Just press on the day again, or on +, to do this.

How do I delete a record?

To delete a record, you can swipe left on the record and press Delete, or press on the record to open it and press the trash can icon in the top left of the screen. Both methods are shown below:

Why do I see a sentiment score above my notes? Is this private?

When your notes contain 8 or more words, an emoji will appear above them to indicate the predicted sentiment. This feature can help you understand if your writing comes across as overly negative or positive, or remind you of what is or isn't working, serving as a guide for your writing. The sentiment is calculated entirely on your device using Apple's Natural Language API, so no data leaves your device, ensuring complete privacy. If you prefer, you can disable this feature in Settings under General.

How do I print?

When you press export (as shown below), you'll see a share sheet. On this, scroll down and press Print (as shown below). You'll need an Apple AirPrint compatible wireless printer to print wirelessly from your iPhone or iPad.

If you don't have an AirPrint compatible wireless printer, you can buy one here.

Can I share any medical information I'm tracking with my doctor?

Yes. The app makes this easy to do. Press the share button (as shown below), select PDF, and then choose your Mail app. The PDF report will be attached to an email you can then send to your doctor.

How can I hide averages or totals in Journal?

You can hide averages and totals in view options, as shown below. That will then only show your entered values, and not averages. This can be useful if you find having the averages/totals in between your entered data confusing.

Can I export to Excel or similar spreadsheet software?

Yes. Follow the instructions above, but select Excel or CSV instead of PDF as output format. Then either save the file on your device, or email it to yourself.

Excel format is more reliable, while CSV may be more widely compatible - both should open in Excel and similar software, like Apple Numbers or Google Sheets.

Who can I send my data to?

You can email it to anyone you like. You might want to periodically email your data to yourself for safekeeping and backup purposes. You can also save the PDF or CSV file on your device for later use.

How do I scroll straight to the current day in month view?

Double-tap the Journal icon in the tab bar at the bottom of your screen.

How do I view data from previous months?

To view data from a previous month (for example, September data when you're currently in October):

  • Go to the Journal tab
  • Press the back button in the top left corner - this will take you to month selection
  • Select the month you want to view (e.g., September)
  • If you don't see your data, press the Journal options button (the 2nd button along the top, next to the back button) and ensure all display options are set to "Show"

Your data is always saved and accessible - you can navigate between months at any time to view your historical records.

If you still don't see your data after checking the month view: Go to Settings > Data > Manage Backups and look for any backups from the month you're trying to view (or early in the following month). If you find a backup from that time period, you can restore from it to recover your data. This can help if you've reinstalled the app or if there was a sync issue.

How do I change the time or date on a record?

Open a record and simply tap on the time or date to change it, as shown below.

How safe is my data?

Your data is encrypted when stored on your device. This means even if your device is stolen, no one can access it.

Where is my data stored?

On your device, and on iCloud. This app uses the same technology as Apple Notes and Photos to save and sync your data across devices, meaning it's very reliable and secure.

Can anyone else see my private data?

No. The data only ever lives on your device and on iCloud, which runs on servers managed by Apple.

Why does my data need to be saved on iCloud?

iCloud enables your data to be backed up, and synced between your devices. Then if you lose your phone or get a new one, your data can be restored from iCloud.

Why isn't my data syncing across my devices?

Your data should automatically be synced across your devices. Ensure that:

  • You're logged into the same iCloud account on all devices.
  • All iOS devices are on the same version of iOS (preferably the latest).
  • Ensure iCloud drive is On on all devices (in Settings > Your Name > iCloud > iCloud Drive, as shown below.

Do I have to have a subscription for each device?

One subscription will remove ads on all devices. If you see ads on any additional devices, go to Settings > Remove Ads, and press Restore Purchase. Ensure each device is logged into the same iCloud account.

How do Backups work?

Backups are made automatically every week by default (although you can turn this off in Settings). You can also create manual backups in Settings > Data.

How many backups are made? Should I delete them?

There‚Äôs no limit to number of backups made. Backups can go back years, and generally take very little space, so deleting them won't make much difference to your device's storage. If you need to free up space, it's better to delete heavier files on your device such as photos and videos.

Are backups synced to iCloud?

Currently backups aren‚Äôt synced on iCloud, but your current data is. That means if you get a new iPhone or iPad, your current data will appear there too, but not your backups, as each device keeps its own local backups.

This means that, for example if you delete a record on your iPhone and it‚Äôs gone from iCloud and your phone, you could still go back to your iPad and restore from one of its older backup snapshots.

Do I need an account to use this app?

No. You can use it straight away without needing to login in or sign up. The app uses your iCloud account to automatically sync your data to any other devices, using Apple's infrastructure. This means it's fast, reliable and secure.

Can I use this app on both my iPhone and iPad?

Yes, and your data is automatically synced between them if logged into the same iCloud account. On the iPad version you have more space for notes, and can see more items.

Is there a Mac version of the app?

Yes. The apps is available for Apple Silicon Macs (M1 onwards). In the Mac app, you can resize the window to see more data on larger screens. You can download the Mac app here on your M1 or later Mac.

I would like to suggest a feature or improvement for the app.

We'd love to hear your feedback. Email us at feedback@feeltracker.com.

Can I turn off the sound?

Yes. Go to the Settings tab and turn off the slider next to Enable Sound Effects.

What's the Trends tab for?

Trends lets you identify what's on your mind, why, and the effect it's having on you. Scroll down for more detail and some examples on how Trends works in your app.

Why do I not see anything in Trends?

For Trends to work, you need to take notes when you save records. You can do this on any record in the Notes field.

What's the Stats tab for?

This currently shows you all records between 2 dates, and an average/total in between that range. This enables you to get an average/total for any period.

What‚Äôs the difference between Journal, Trends and Stats?

Journal is the main diary/log section which lets you input data and view it on a monthly/yearly/lifetime basis, with averages and totals

Trends lets you identify patterns in the data you're recording in Journal so you can act on them.

Stats lets you see your data in chronological order (newest item first) without monthly or yearly grouping, and let's you see averages and totals between any two dates.

Should I log out or shut down, to save phone memory and battery?

There's no need at all to log out ‚Äì the device automatically unloads apps/resources from memory as needed.

Modern iPhones and iPads have a lot of energy-efficient memory, so apps can stay in memory for a long time without any adverse effects. Access to this memory is secure, and is already proteced by Face ID, Touch ID, or a passcode.

If you'd like to close an app anyway (for example if it has become unresponsive) you can follow Apple's instructions here.

There's no need to login either, as the app uses your iCloud account so already can sync/backup data across your devices, similar to how the Photos and Notes app do, without requiring any identifying personal data to be shared.

If I don't log out, is that safe?

Yes. As soon as you press the side button on the device, to lock it as you normally do, no one can get into your app or data while it's locked.

What's with the ads?

We want you to first try the app and see if you find useful, without any distractions - you can do this for free, without seeing Google ads. After you save 7 records, you may see some Google ads, which help support the app and keep it free.

I don‚Äôt like ads! Can I pay to remove them?

Yes! To do this, press the ‚ùé button on the banner. This will bring up the option to subscribe, for a nominal fee. While you are subscribed you will not see any ads.

I'm unable to pay, but hate ads in apps!

We hear you. These customised native ads are designed to blend in with the rest of the app and still look good, without being jarring or spammy. We want you to be able to enjoy using the app, even if you're unable to pay. Don't forget to tell your friends about it!

Why should I subscribe? Why can‚Äôt I pay just once?

A small regular subscription fee makes the app easier to try without large upfront cost. Long-term, subscription revenue helps us maintain the app and funds the development of useful new features.

Is there anything I can do to support this app?

We're reliant on good reviews to grow the app and keep building new features. Please leave a review by following the link for your app:

  • Blood Pressure Monitor Checker
  • Daily Journaling
  • Feeltracker Mood Journal
  • Weight and Body Fat Journal
  • Sleep and Nap Journal

I want to cancel my paid subscription

Thank you for trying the app. Let me know if there‚Äôs anything I can do better at gs@feeltracker.com and I'll try to help. Often, fixes and improvements based on user feedback are shipped in an app update on the same or next day.

If still not satisfied, you can cancel your subscription here.

Blood Pressure App

Does the app connect to my blood pressure monitor via Bluetooth?

No, the app does not connect directly to blood pressure monitors via Bluetooth. Instead, we've focused on making manual entry effortless through AI camera scanning technology. Simply point your iPhone's camera at your monitor's display after taking a reading, and the app automatically reads the numbers. This works with virtually any blood pressure monitor that has a digital display, regardless of brand or model. There's no pairing required, no specific device compatibility to worry about, and it takes just seconds. This feature is always free and unlimited.

How does AI Camera Scanning work?

After taking your blood pressure reading, open the app and tap the "+" button, then select "Scan with Camera." Hold your phone steady about 6-12 inches away from your monitor's display, making sure the numbers are clearly visible and well-lit. The app will automatically read the systolic, diastolic, and pulse values. For best results, ensure good lighting and keep your phone steady while scanning. This works with most digital monitors including OMRON, Microlife, and Beurer brands.

Why am I seeing duplicate entries?

This is usually caused by Apple Health sync configuration. The most common issue is having only write permissions enabled for Apple Health, but not read permissions. To fix this: Go to Settings > Data > Apple Health, and make sure BOTH read AND write permissions are enabled for Blood Pressure and Heart Rate - not just write. The app needs read permission to check if a reading already exists before importing from Health.

Can I track readings for multiple family members?

A tags feature is coming within the next few months that will let you track readings for multiple people on one device. You'll be able to tag each entry with a person's name and then generate individual reports for each family member.

My data isn't syncing between my iPhone and iPad. Why?

First, make sure you're signed into the same iCloud account on both devices. Go to Settings > [Your Name] and check the Apple ID. Second, verify that iCloud Drive is enabled on both devices (Settings > [Your Name] > iCloud > iCloud Drive). Your data syncs automatically through iCloud, but it requires an internet connection and can take a few minutes. Try opening the app on each device and pulling down to refresh.

What does the subscription include? What's free?

All core tracking features are completely free: unlimited entries, AI camera scanning (always free), all charts and trends, Apple Health sync, and PDF/CSV exports. The subscription adds: ad removal for a clean experience, enhanced AI chat (100 uses per day vs 10 free), and access to advanced AI features. All future premium features will be included for subscribers.

What is MAP and should I track it?

MAP (Mean Arterial Pressure) represents the average pressure in your arteries during one cardiac cycle. It's calculated automatically for every reading. MAP is particularly important for LVAD (Left Ventricular Assist Device) patients and others with specific cardiovascular conditions. To enable MAP display, go to Settings > Blood Pressure > Show Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP). Customizable MAP ranges are coming in version 2.8.x.

How do I use note templates to save time?

When entering a note (like "Morning reading - before medication"), tap the "Template" button at the bottom left of the notes field and save it as a template. Next time you enter a reading, tap "Template" again and select from your saved templates - the text is inserted instantly. This is great for recurring notes like "Morning - pre-medication" or "Evening - after dinner."

What's too high or low a blood pressure?

Your blood pressure should normally be between 90-140 for systolic value, and 60-90 for diastolic value. If it's outside this range, you should speak to a doctor.

What's the ideal blood pressure?

According to the NHS, ideal blood pressure is between 90/60 mmHg and 120/80 mmHg. However, that can vary depending on sex, age, and other variables. Therefore it is best to consult your local doctor for an accurate assessment of your blood pressure based on your own individual circumstances.

How do I measure my blood pressure?

Blood pressure is measured using a digital blood pressure monitor. Here you can find blood pressure monitors that work great with the Camera Scan AI feature. The app can automatically read values from most digital monitors including OMRON, Microlife, and Beurer brands.

What's Trends for?

With Trends, this app takes your data and notes, and shows what things affect you and how. For example, you could see that you meditated 20 times last year, and that meditation lowers your blood pressure. Conversely, you could see that every time you meet Bob, you argue, and he raises your blood pressure. The more you use notes, the more useful Trends can be.

Can you explain Trends with an example?

For example, you go running 10 times. 5 times, your blood pressure goes down by 10, and the other times it goes down by 5. Trends will show that on average, running helps reduce your blood pressure by about 7.5 points.

Feeltracker Mood Diary App

What's Trends for?

With Trends, this app takes your data and notes, and shows what things affect you and how. For example, you could see that you met Jane 20 times last year, and that on average, Jane makes you very happy. Conversely, you could see that every time you meet Bob, you argue, and he makes you unhappy. The more you use notes, the more useful Trends can be.

Can you explain Trends with an example?

For example, you meet Jane 10 times. 5 times she made you very happy (+2), and 5 times she made you fairly happy (+1). Trends will show that on average Jane makes you quite (+1.5) happy.

Daily Journaling Notes App

What's Trends for?

With Trends, this app takes your data and notes, and shows what words are most on your mind. For example, you could see that you used a word 20 times last year. Conversely, you could see that you used another word 50 times - a lot more often. The more you use notes, the more useful Trends can be.

Can you explain Trends with an example?

For example, you write about Jane 120 times in your notes, more than about your job, which you write about 50 times. Trends in this case shows that clearly the top thing on your mind was Jane.

Sleep Diary App

What's Trends for?

With Trends, this app takes your data and notes, and shows what things affect you and how. For example, you could see that you drank a lot of coffee last week, and that because of this you had less sleep. Conversely, you could see that every time you eat salad or go to the gym, you lose sleep better. The more you use notes, the more useful Trends can be.

Can you explain Trends with an example?

For example, you drink coffee 10 times. 5 of those times, you underslept 2 hours, and the other 5 times you underslept 1 hour. Trends will show that on average, drinking coffee causes you to undersleep by 1.5 hours.

Weight and Body Fat Food Diary App

What's Trends for?

With Trends, this app takes your data and notes, and shows what things affect you and how. For example, you could see that you ate fast food 20 times last year, and that over time, you gain weight when you eat fast food. Conversely, you could see that every time you eat salad or go to the gym, you lose weight. The more you use notes, the more useful Trends can be.

Can you explain Trends with an example?

For example, you eat donuts 10 times. 5 times, your weight goes up by 0.1kg. The other 5 times your weight goes up by 0.3kg. Trends will show that on average, eating donuts makes your weight go up by 0.2kg.

How do I measure body fat?

Body Fat is reported by specially designed weight scales that measure body composition, as well as the weight. Here is an example of such scale, from Omron. There will be other options available too from other brands - the thing to look for is ‚ÄúBody Composition‚Äù as well as weighing scales.

Note also that even if you only enter weight, you‚Äôll still see a BMI value (to the left of weight, color coded), which will give a broad indication of whether you are of a healthy weight (where green is good, and red is overweight).

Contact Us

If you have any questions or suggestions, do not hesitate to contact us at support@feeltracker.com.

meta.title: Privacy Policy - Feeltracker

data.bodyContent:
Privacy Policy

Custom Arts Ltd built the Feeltracker app as a Freemium app. This SERVICE is provided by Custom Arts Ltd at no cost and is intended for use as is.

This page is used to inform visitors regarding our policies with the collection, use, and disclosure of information if anyone decided to use our Service.

If you choose to use our Service, then you agree to the collection and use of information in relation to this policy. However, the Feeltracker app does not collect or store any personally identifiable information (PII) on our servers. All data generated by the app is stored locally on your device or synced with your personal iCloud account. We do not have access to this data.

Information Collection and Use

For a better experience while using our Service, the Feeltracker app may utilize iCloud for data syncing across your devices. This data is stored securely in your iCloud account, and we do not collect or access any personal data from you. You can control iCloud data through your device's iCloud settings.

The app does use third-party services that may collect aggregated, non-identifiable data (such as usage analytics or crash reports) to improve the app experience.

Link to the privacy policy of third-party service providers used by the app:

  • AdMob
  • Google Analytics for Firebase
  • Firebase Crashlytics
  • RevenueCat

iCloud Syncing

Feeltracker stores and syncs user data across devices using Apple‚Äôs iCloud service. This allows you to access your health diary across your Apple devices seamlessly. Data stored in iCloud is protected by Apple‚Äôs privacy and security measures. We do not have access to this data. For more information on Apple‚Äôs iCloud privacy, please refer to Apple‚Äôs Privacy Policy.

Log Data

In the case of an error or crash in the app, we collect log data through third-party services such as Firebase Crashlytics. This log data does not include personally identifiable information and is used only to diagnose and fix errors to improve the app‚Äôs performance.

Cookies

The Feeltracker app itself does not use cookies. However, the app may use third-party services or libraries that use ‚Äúcookies‚Äù to collect non-personally identifiable data. You have the option to either accept or refuse these cookies and know when a cookie is being sent to your device. If you choose to refuse the cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of the Service.

Service Providers

We may employ third-party companies and individuals for the following reasons:

  • To facilitate our Service;
  • To provide the Service on our behalf;
  • To perform Service-related services; or
  • To assist us in analyzing how our Service is used.

These third-party services may collect non-personally identifiable information as described above, but they are obligated not to disclose or use the information for any other purpose.

Security

We value your trust in providing us your information through the use of iCloud. We strive to use commercially acceptable means of protecting it. However, please remember that no method of transmission over the internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure and reliable, and we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Links to Other Sites

This Service may contain links to other sites. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to that site. Note that these external sites are not operated by us. Therefore, we strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of these websites. We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party sites or services.

Children‚Äôs Privacy

The Feeltracker app is not intended for children under the age of 12. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from users under 12 years of age. If we become aware that a child under 12 has provided us with personal information, we will take steps to delete it immediately.

If you are a parent or guardian and believe that your child under 12 has provided us with personal information, please contact us so that we can take appropriate action.

Use of OpenAI Services

Our app integrates services provided by OpenAI, which may process user inputs (such as text or other data) to generate AI-powered feedback, suggestions, or content. When using these services, the data you provide is transmitted to OpenAI‚Äôs servers for processing. This data is used solely for the purpose of providing the requested AI response and is not stored or used for any other purpose unless explicitly stated in OpenAI's privacy policy.

We recommend reviewing OpenAI's privacy policy to understand how your data is handled by them: OpenAI Privacy Policy.

By using this feature in our app, you acknowledge and agree that your data will be shared with and processed by OpenAI in accordance with their policies.

Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. Thus, you are advised to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.

This policy is effective as of 2024 October 19th.

Contact Us

If you have any questions or suggestions about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us at support@feeltracker.com.

meta.title: Terms and Conditions - Feeltracker

data.bodyContent:
Terms and Conditions

By downloading or using the app, these terms will automatically apply to you ‚Äì you should make sure therefore that you read them carefully before using the app. You‚Äôre not allowed to copy or modify the app, any part of the app, or our trademarks in any way. You‚Äôre not allowed to attempt to extract the source code of the app, and you also shouldn‚Äôt try to translate the app into other languages or make derivative versions. The app itself, and all the trademarks, copyright, database rights, and other intellectual property rights related to it, still belong to Custom Arts Ltd.

Custom Arts Ltd is committed to ensuring that the app is as useful and efficient as possible. For that reason, we reserve the right to make changes to the app or to charge for its services at any time and for any reason. We will never charge you for the app or its services without making it very clear to you exactly what you‚Äôre paying for.

The Feeltracker app stores and processes data using Apple‚Äôs iCloud service. All data generated by the app is synced across your devices via iCloud, and Custom Arts Ltd does not have access to this data. You can control iCloud data storage through your device's iCloud settings. It‚Äôs your responsibility to keep your phone and access to the app secure. We recommend that you do not jailbreak or root your phone, which is the process of removing software restrictions and limitations imposed by the official operating system of your device. It could make your phone vulnerable to malware/viruses/malicious programs, compromise your phone‚Äôs security features, and it could mean that the Feeltracker app won‚Äôt work properly or at all.

The app does use third-party services that declare their own Terms and Conditions.

Links to the Terms and Conditions of third-party service providers used by the app:

  • AdMob
  • Google Analytics for Firebase
  • Firebase Crashlytics
  • RevenueCat

You should be aware that there are certain things that Custom Arts Ltd will not take responsibility for. Certain functions of the app will require the app to have an active internet connection. The connection can be Wi-Fi or provided by your mobile network provider, but Custom Arts Ltd cannot take responsibility for the app not working at full functionality if you don‚Äôt have access to Wi-Fi, or if you don‚Äôt have any of your data allowance left.

If you‚Äôre using the app outside of an area with Wi-Fi, you should remember that the terms of the agreement with your mobile network provider will still apply. As a result, you may be charged by your mobile provider for the cost of data for the duration of the connection while accessing the app, or other third-party charges. In using the app, you‚Äôre accepting responsibility for any such charges, including roaming data charges if you use the app outside of your home territory (i.e. region or country) without turning off data roaming. If you are not the bill payer for the device on which you‚Äôre using the app, please be aware that we assume that you have received permission from the bill payer for using the app.

Similarly, Custom Arts Ltd cannot always take responsibility for the way you use the app. For example, you need to make sure that your device stays charged ‚Äì if it runs out of battery and you can‚Äôt turn it on to avail of the Service, Custom Arts Ltd cannot accept responsibility.

With respect to Custom Arts Ltd‚Äôs responsibility for your use of the app, it‚Äôs important to bear in mind that although we endeavor to ensure that it is updated and correct at all times, we do rely on third parties to provide information to us so that we can make it available to you. Custom Arts Ltd accepts no liability for any loss, direct or indirect, you experience as a result of relying wholly on this functionality of the app.

At some point, we may wish to update the app. The app is currently available on iOS ‚Äì the requirements for the system (and for any additional systems we decide to extend the availability of the app to) may change, and you‚Äôll need to download the updates if you want to keep using the app. Custom Arts Ltd does not promise that it will always update the app so that it is relevant to you and/or works with the iOS version that you have installed on your device. However, you promise to always accept updates to the application when offered to you. We may also wish to stop providing the app and may terminate use of it at any time without giving notice of termination to you. Unless we tell you otherwise, upon any termination, (a) the rights and licenses granted to you in these terms will end; (b) you must stop using the app, and (if needed) delete it from your device.

OpenAI Services and Liability

Our app utilizes OpenAI‚Äôs API to provide AI-driven features, such as generating feedback or content based on user input. Please note that while we strive for accuracy and usefulness, the content generated by OpenAI may be imperfect or inaccurate. As such, any decisions made based on AI-generated content should be made with caution, and we do not accept liability for any outcomes resulting from the use of OpenAI‚Äôs services.

By using the AI features in our app, you agree to the following:

  • You understand that AI-generated content is for informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional advice (e.g., medical, legal, or financial advice).
  • You accept that data you submit to the AI service will be processed by OpenAI in accordance with their terms and privacy policy.
  • We reserve the right to update, modify, or disable AI features in the app at any time.

For more information on OpenAI's terms, please visit: OpenAI Terms of Use.

Changes to These Terms and Conditions

We may update our Terms and Conditions from time to time. Thus, you are advised to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Terms and Conditions on this page.

These terms and conditions are effective as of 2024 October 19th.

Contact Us

If you have any questions or suggestions about our Terms and Conditions, do not hesitate to contact us at support@feeltracker.com.

Technologie & Funktionen

K√ºnstliche Intelligenz-F√§higkeiten

Alle Feeltracker-Apps werden von fortschrittlicher KI-Technologie unterst√ºtzt:

Export und Teilen

  • Excel-Tabellen: Detaillierte Datenexporte f√ºr die Analyse
  • JSON-Dateien: Vollst√§ndige Datensicherungen f√ºr Migration und Archivierung

Globale Reichweite

H√§ufige Anwendungsf√§lle

F√ºr die Blutdruck√ºberwachung

Blood Pressure ist die Nummer 1 Blutdruck-App in Gro√übritannien, ideal f√ºr:

  • Management von Bluthochdruck (Hypertonie)

F√ºr die Verfolgung der psychischen Gesundheit

Feeltracker Stimmungstracker unterst√ºtzt:

F√ºr das Schlafst√∂rungs-Management

Feeltracker Schlaftracker wird verwendet von:

Technische Informationen

Systemanforderungen

Wichtiger medizinischer Haftungsausschluss

Feeltracker-Anwendungen sind pers√∂nliche Gesundheits-Tracking-Tools und keine medizinischen Ger√§te. Sie sollten nicht f√ºr medizinische Diagnosen oder Behandlungsentscheidungen verwendet werden. Konsultieren Sie immer qualifizierte medizinische Fachkr√§fte f√ºr medizinische Beratung, Diagnose und Behandlung.
